metadata.synopsis: Branches depending on whether plaeyrs heard about the hammer, took the deal or not and whether voss is waiting in SC.
metadata.how_to_trigger: After talking to Rapahel in Sharess Caress

1.speaker: Lae'zel
1.text: Shka'keth! You know Raphael holds the key to the prince's freedom - and you turned away.

94.speaker: Lae'zel
94.text: We can not let it remain in the devil's possession!

3.speaker: Lae'zel
3.text: We cannot slay the traitor prince unless we loose him from his astral prison.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *The tadpole reveals your mind to Lae'zel. She knows you refused to bargain with Raphael.*

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: We cannot slay the traitor prince unless we loose him from his astral prison.

112.speaker: Lae'zel
112.text: The means to do so was within our grasp - and you refused it.

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *The tadpole reveals your mind to Lae'zel. She knows you bargained with Raphael.*

96.speaker: Lae'zel
96.text: I'd sooner have imagined shattering a planet with my bare fist than taking a deal with a devil.
96.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

81.speaker: Lae'zel
81.text: But we shouldn't regret the bargain, not for one instant. Raphael can have his crown, if it means breaking Orpheus free and slicing him open.
81.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Now we just need to get back into the Astral Prism.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: The Emperor can't shut us out forever.
33.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

85.speaker: Lae'zel
85.text: The closer the elder brain, the closer we come to killing Orpheus in his own astral prison.
85.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Can we trust Raphael? That Orphic Hammer could be worthless.

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: Devil's are slippery creatures. They'd twist their tongues into knots to convince you a rockpile was mithril.
56.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

87.speaker: Lae'zel
87.text: You know that better than anyone, Wyll.
87.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: Ask Wyll. He knows that better than anyone.
62.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

136.speaker: Lae'zel
136.text: But a broker is as bound by his contract as his buyer. The Hammer must be real, or Raphael could never have the Crown.
136.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: Now, to the Sharess' Caress taproom. I mean to crush the slithering snake we call Voss.
44.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: When the opportunity comes, we'll return to the Prism. Until then, keep the Hammer close.

22.speaker: Lae'zel
22.text: We meet him in the Sharess' Caress taproom, just as he asked -
22.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

119.speaker: Lae'zel
119.text: - and we slit his throat before he can utter another word against the Undying Queen.
119.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: Return to Raphael. We must hear him out.
23.context: NodeContext: SHKAH-keth. (Calling the player an asshole)

51.speaker: Lae'zel
51.text: We cannot slay the traitor prince unless we loose him from his astral prison.
51.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *The tadpole reveals your mind to Lae'zel. She knows you refused to bargain with Raphael.*

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: The means to loosing the Prince of the Comet was within our grasp - and you refused it.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Because we don't need the deal. We can take the Hammer from the House of Hope.

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: Chk. I wanted to follow the open valley - the easy way out. You chose the brambled path.

39.speaker: Lae'zel
39.text: First, we slay Voss, the traitor who seeks the end of Queen Vlaakith's glorious reign. Then we find our way to Raphael's House of Hope.
39.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

126.speaker: Lae'zel
126.text: We'll take the Orphic Hammer, smash Orpheus' bonds, and slice him open on the spot.

111.speaker: Lae'zel
111.text: First, we slay Voss, the traitor who seeks the end of Queen Vlaakith's glorious reign. Then we return to Raphael's House of Hope.
111.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: We'll find a way into Raphael's lair. And we'll take the Orphic Hammer, smash Orpheus' bonds, and slice him open.
28.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: Vlaakith, ba na'zin. Vlaakith, ik sa'ith!
26.context:
NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH.

Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry.

104.speaker: Lae'zel
104.text: We'll return to Raphael's lair. And we'll take the Orphic Hammer, smash Orpheus' bonds, and slice him open.
104.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: I'm annoyed by it. And I admire you for it.

102.speaker: Lae'zel
102.text: We must speak with Voss. Then we find our way to Raphael's House of Hope.

50.speaker: Lae'zel
50.text: We must speak with Voss. Then we return to Raphael's House of Hope.

98.speaker: Lae'zel
98.text: We'll take the Orphic Hammer and use it to smash the true heir's bonds.
98.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

103.speaker: Lae'zel
103.text: Yisk Gith'ka tavki krash'ht - the githyanki will be free.
103.context:
NodeContext: YISK GITH-kah TAV-ki KRAHSH-het

Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

129.speaker: Lae'zel
129.text: We'll find a way into Raphael's lair. And we'll take the Orphic Hammer and smash Orpheus' bonds.

105.speaker: Lae'zel
105.text: We'll return to Raphael's lair. And we'll take the Orphic Hammer and smash Orpheus' bonds.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I don't trust the devil. That Orphic Hammer is probably worthless.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: Don't be a fool. A broker is as bound by his contract as his buyer. The Hammer must be real, or Raphael could never take the Crown.

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: Lucky for us we've another option, all glory to Vlaakith.

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: Lucky for us we've another option, glory be to the Comet.

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: The devil keeps the Orphic Hammer in his lair. If we can find a way in, we can take it.

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: I'll use it to smash the true heir's bonds, and then slice him open on the spot.

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: First, we kill Voss. Then, we go to the House of Hope.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: Just don't expect a lavish spread awaiting us this time.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: I'll use it to smash the true heir's bonds. Yisk Gith'ka tavki krash'ht - the githyanki will be free.
36.context:
NodeContext: YISK GITH-kah TAV-ki KRAHSH-het

Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

128.speaker: Lae'zel
128.text: First, to Voss. Then, to Raphael's House of Hope.
128.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

114.speaker: Lae'zel
114.text: The devil keeps the Orphic Hammer in his lair. We'll return to the House of Hope and take it.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm not about to let Raphael become Archdevil Supreme.

101.speaker: Lae'zel
101.text: Why? Is he any worse than Asmodeus, do you suppose - The Reigning Serpent, he who harvests souls to fight an unwinnable Blood War?

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: Worse than Mephistopheles, the devil who slayed his own son, he whose experiments threaten to melt his own frozen throne?

60.speaker: Lae'zel
60.text: Bah - your mind is made up. But there's another option, all glory to Vlaakith.

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: Bah - your mind is made up. But there's another option, glory be to the Comet.
0.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I'm questioning it, myself. It's not too late to change my mind, is it?

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: Not while Raphael's still in Sharess' Caress, it isn't.

54.speaker: Lae'zel
54.text: Speak with him, plead your case. If you won't, well - there's one more option, all glory to Vlaakith.

121.speaker: Lae'zel
121.text: Speak with him, plead your case. If you won't, well - there's one more option, glory be to the Comet.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I've made enough devil deals for one lifetime, Lae'zel.

8.speaker: Lae'zel
8.text: Ah, the mighty Blade of Avernus - so kind, so benevolent, until it's the githyanki who would suffer.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: Bah - why should I protest? Your mind is made up. But there's another option, all glory to Vlaakith.

99.speaker: Lae'zel
99.text: Bah - why should I protest? Your mind is made up. But there's another option, glory be to the Comet.

100.speaker: Lae'zel
100.text: Ah, Wyll Ravengard, Grand Duke to be - so courageous, so benevolent until it's the githyanki who would suffer.

131.speaker: Lae'zel
131.text: Ah, the heroic Blade of Frontiers - so kind, so benevolent, until it's the githyanki who would suffer.

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: Voss is waiting. He should know we took the Orphic Hammer.

74.speaker: Lae'zel
74.text: Raphael must keep the Orphic Hammer in his so-called House of Hope.

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: The means to loosing the Prince of the Comet was within our grasp - and you refused it.
78.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: But we shouldn't regret the bargain, not for one instant. Raphael can have his crown, if it means breaking Prince Orpheus free.
7.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Now we just need to get back into the Astral Prism.

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: The Emperor can't shut us out forever.
70.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

59.speaker: Lae'zel
59.text: The closer the elder brain, the closer we come to facing Orpheus in his own prison.
59.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Can we trust Raphael? That Orphic Hammer could be worthless.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

120.speaker: Lae'zel
120.text: Devils are slippery creatures. They'd twist their tongues into knots to convince you a rockpile was mithril.
120.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: You know that better than anyone, Wyll.
49.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

133.speaker: Lae'zel
133.text: But a broker is as bound by his contract as his buyer. The Hammer must be real, or Raphael could never have the Crown.
133.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: Now, to the Sharess' Caress taproom. We must tell Voss the news.
52.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

117.speaker: Lae'zel
117.text: When the opportunity comes, we'll return to the Prism. Until then, keep the Hammer close.

115.speaker: Lae'zel
115.text: Ask Wyll. He knows that better than anyone.
115.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Let's hope Orpheus doesn't rip off our heads the moment we free him.

58.speaker: Lae'zel
58.text: The prince will be suspicious. But he won't be reckless enough to turn on his liberators.
58.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

4.speaker: Lae'zel
4.text: There'd be too little to gain from our deaths, and too much to lose.
4.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

88.speaker: Lae'zel
88.text: Shka'keth! You know Raphael holds the key to the prince's freedom - and you turned away.
88.context: NodeContext: SHKAH-keth. (Calling the player an asshole)

77.speaker: Lae'zel
77.text: Either go to Raphael and hear him out, or tell Voss you've failed him and the githyanki people.

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: It will not be a pleasant reunion.

108.speaker: Lae'zel
108.text: Return to Raphael. We've no other choice.

91.speaker: Lae'zel
91.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

93.speaker: Lae'zel
93.text: Raphael must keep the Orphic Hammer in his so-called House of Hope.

95.speaker: Lae'zel
95.text: Now, to find our way in.

106.speaker: Lae'zel
106.text: Voss is waiting. He should know what happened with Raphael.

107.speaker: Lae'zel
107.text: Now, we can only wait. We'll slay Orpheus when we next enter the Astral Prism.
107.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: Now, we can only wait. We'll free Orpheus when we next enter the Astral Prism.

122.speaker: Lae'zel
122.text: Return to Raphael. He holds the key that would unleash the traitor prince.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: We can't allow him to keep it.

135.speaker: Lae'zel
135.text: Voss is waiting. It's time we end his misery.
135.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.
